intro: Bleekeria kalocarpa, commonly known as the Natal hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous small seeds. The plant is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions.
